sub_title: Applied physicist | Optical Scientist | Research and Development | System Design and Prototyping
summary:
• PhD in Physics 
• Over ten years of demonstrated experience in science and industry
• Research and development scientist, project management and consultancy experience
• Design and development of trace gas sensors for industrial applications (TRL9)
• Technical lead: Built the first ever proof of concept piezoelectric based manipulator for deformable mirrors for extreme UV lithography (ASML) systems in collaboration with Carl ZEISS SMT.

• I am currently working as an optical scientist at ASMPT ALSI. Before this position, I was a research scientist at the Radboud University (RU), where we developed and built trance gas sensors based on laser absorption spectroscopy. Earlier, I was a postdoc researcher at the MESA+ Institute for Nanotechnology at University of Twente (UT) in the Netherlands and at NTNU in Norway. 

• Recent projects: 
             -	MAX-FRESH: EU funded € 2.8 million, H2020 (Grant agreement ID: 958840) 
             -	SMILE2: Industry funded (HTSM i30) with industry partners Carl Zeiss SMT GmbH, DEMCON, and SolMates

• Skills and specialties:
- Materials physics
- Spectroscopy
- Optical and semiconductor materials. 
- Thin films and metrology
- MEMS and nano-fabrication
- Nanotechnology and Nanomaterials (semiconductors and metals)
- Solar cells, specifically intermediate band solar cell
- Pulsed laser ablation and deposition of oxides, metals, and semiconductors. 
- Deposition skills (PLD, sputtering, e-beam and thermal evaporation)
- Material characterizations (XPS, AFM, SEM, FIB, EDX, XRD, GIXRD, RBS, PL, UV-VIS spectroscopy, spectroscopic ellipsometry (SE), DBLI, 4-point probe, white light interferometer, Van der Pauw technique, profilometer, photo-current and quantum efficiency measurements, and I-V characteristics)
- LabVIEW, MATLAB, CleWin, Gwyddion, , Latex, Origin, and Microsoft office

profile_positions.description:
- Member of the management and development team of H2020 EU funded project: MAX-FRESH € 2.8 million (Grant agreement ID: 958840)
- Leading design and development of a fully automated multi-species trace gas sensor for industrial applications (TRL9)
- Broadband spectroscopy to sense minute quantities of trace gases in complicated gas mixtures

  Skills and hands-on experience: 
      •	Laser spectroscopy and trace gas sensing
      •	Modelling, data acquisition, analysis, and processing
      •	Software and programming: MATLAB, LabVIEW, Origin, and Microsoft office
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Topic: Smart interactive mirrors for lithography at EUV wavelengths
  - Designed the process flow and fabricated a proof of concept piezoelectric based manipulator for deformable mirrors for extreme UV lithography systems of ASML in collaboration with Carl ZEISS SMT. 
  - Investigated on piezoelectric films in order to fabricate deformable micromirrors; Study on microstructure, hysteresis, and performance by thin film deposition, metrology, and device fabrication and testing.
 - Established a reproducible deposition process by finding hidden process parameters 
 - Design of a custom-made pulsed laser deposition (PLD) and sputter UHV system.
 - Daily supervisor of PhD and MSc students.
profile_positions.title: Postdoc researcher at MESA+ institute

company.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

profile_positions.company: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
profile_positions.description:
We investigated several potential intermediate band materials such as Cr doped ZnS, reduced MoO3, and Ag doped Si. 
A major part of the work was on deposition and characterization of potential intermediate band materials. However, in this position I also focused on fabrication of solar cells; I studied the solar cell properties both at NTNU and at the institute for solar cells in Madrid. We also had other collaborators from the department of chemistry and department of materials science at NTNU. The research resulted in 6 journal papers and one conference paper.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.company: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
profile_positions.description: Performed regular lab maintenance (two PLD systems), trained the new lab users for the equipment and safety regulations.
profile_positions.title: Lab responsible

profile_positions.company: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
profile_positions.description:
Course responsible and lecturer for "Energy and Environmental Physics"; guest lecturer on solar cells for several courses
The course content of "Energy and Environmental Physics":
* The energy budget of the earth, radiation and the greenhouse effect, ozone and life, climate and weather, and climate change.
 * Methods and the physical basis for exploitation of conventional and renewable energy sources
        - Fossil fuels and nuclear energy.
        - Power from wind, bio-mass and bio-fuel, solar water heating and other solar thermal applications, photovoltaics, ocean waves, hydro-power, tidal and geothermal energy.
* Energy storage for grid electricity, batteries, fuel cells, and hydrogen technology, and fusion research.
profile_positions.title: Course coordinator and lecturer

profile_positions.company: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
profile_positions.description:
Cr-doped ZnS was fabricated and studied as a potential intermediate band material. The work was mainly focused on growth of high quality Cr-doped ZnS films by pulsed laser deposition and molecular beam epitaxy, and studying the materials properties. In addition, solar cells based on Cr-doped ZnS were made and investigated. The outcomes were published in 5 journal papers and several conference papers. 

In short:
* Deposited ZnS and Cr-doped ZnS by pulsed laser deposition (PLD). 
* Studied the deposited films with XPS, XRD, SEM, AFM, EDS, RBS, TEM, 4-Point Probe, UV-VIS spectroscopy, Spectroscopic Ellipsometry, and other relevant techniques.
* Device fabrication, contacting, and current-voltage measurement of the devices.
* Lab work including design/purchase of vacuum and deposition equipment as well as maintenance of the systems.
* Co-supervision of master students.
profile_positions.title: PhD Fellow

profile_positions.company: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
profile_positions.description: Assisted in the design of a pulsed laser deposition (PLD) and sputter UHV system.
profile_positions.title: Project assistance

company.name: Instituto de Energía Solar - Universidad Politénica de Madrid

profile_positions.company: Instituto de Energía Solar - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid
profile_positions.description: The intermediate band solar cells based on Cr doped ZnS were  studied at the institute for solar cells in Madrid. We carried out experiments such as two photon photocurrent and voltage preservation. The outcomes were published as a journal paper in the journal of Solar Cell Materials and Solar Cells.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Scholar
